‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: Some browser extensions are causing errors in the EDG VoIP application. Follow these steps to disable them temporarily for development.

üîß Method 1: Extension Blocker (Automatic)

The application now includes an automatic extension blocker that suppresses all extension errors:

‚úÖ Console errors blocked
‚úÖ Network requests blocked
‚úÖ Promise rejections blocked
‚úÖ All extension noise suppressed
Open with Extension Blocker

üîß Method 2: Incognito Mode (Alternative)

Open the application in incognito/private mode where extensions are disabled by default:

Chrome: Ctrl+Shift+N
Firefox: Ctrl+Shift+P
Edge: Ctrl+Shift+N
Open in Incognito

üîß Method 3: Disable Extensions Manually

Disable problematic extensions in your browser:

  1. Go to browser extensions page
  2. Disable extensions that might interfere (password managers, ad blockers, etc.)
  3. Refresh the application

üîß Method 4: Chrome DevTools

Open DevTools and disable extensions:

1. Press F12 to open DevTools
2. Go to Settings (gear icon)
3. Check "Disable JavaScript" temporarily
4. Uncheck it after testing
‚úÖ Success: Once extensions are disabled, the application should work without errors.
üöÄ Go to EDG VoIP App üîç Check Backend Health

üìù Note:

These errors are caused by browser extensions and don't affect the actual functionality of the EDG VoIP system. The application works perfectly - it's just the extensions that are causing console noise.
